header.type: HUMAN RIGHTS VIOLATIONS, SUBMISSIONS QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS

testimony: Mr Nxasana you are going to talk about yourself.  Is that so?
You were one of the people who were detained after the Ngquza incident.  Is that so?
Where were you detained and when?
I was first detained at Mkhambati and then Umtata.
You have mentioned Umzimkhulu and Umgundlovo.
Yes.   That was after Umtata, they took me to Umzimkhulu, from Umzimkhulu to Pietermaritzburg.
What was your period of your detention?
When you were in detention, what did they do to you?
I was beaten up in Mkhambathi.  This is when I told them, I confronted them, they had beaten me up and they had broken my joints on my hands.
It was a forest.  There were just tents there in the forest.
Yes.  I was beaten up in Mkhambathi.
You said that there were just sails there.  Are you talking about tents?
We were beaten up.  They beat me up on my buttocks and my hand was injured.  I would scream.
I see that they would tie you up.
Would you like to add anything to your statement Sir?
I do not have more evidence, except the places I mentioned, where I was beaten up.
What I am trying to ask, are you well now?
Well, there is not much I can say.  There was a court case and I was released.
Do you have a request to the Commission?
Well I could have a request, because I was injured.   I almost deaf, because I was electrocuted.
Therefore, what request do you have?
I do not know what the Commission can do for me.   I told you my state of affairs.
Is that all?  Is there something you would like to add?
I cannot hear you properly.   I have finished, provided that you are going to do something for me.
Thank you.  I hand over to the Chairperson.
Thank you to all of you.
